page.title: 18LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: There is a wealth of history in the area dating back to cave dwellers of the stone age. Iron and bronze age settlements are visible from the air. Two standing stones are situated not far from each other, in fields and are thought to be 2000 years old. Capel Dyddgen is situatd on a minor road between the B4306 Pontyberem-Carmarthen and the B4309 Pontyates-Carmarthen roads. This Chapel is now disused and derelict, but was once a Chapel of Ease of the Established Church under Llanyfeilog Parish. Drysgeirch Mill a water driven corn grinding mill closed in the 1920's, but is expected to be renovated and to be in working order in the near future.
